metadata.title: Thursday, 19th July, 2012
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    when boreholes will be sunk in rural constituencies such as Pemba Parliamentary Constituency, which are in dire need of safe drinking water;
(b)    when the Chomowa dam will be repaired; and
(c)    when Munyona and Chinwaboobwe dams will be constructed.
(a)    how many Immigration Assistants have not been promoted from the intake recruited in 1993;
(b)    whether the Government has provided transport to the following immigration stations:
(i)    Mazabuka; (ii)    Choma; (iii)    Kalomo; (iv)    Kazungula Border; and
(v)    Victoria Falls Border; and
(c)    when the Government last procured handcuffs for the Immigration Department.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when communication towers will be constructed at the following areas in Pambashe Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)    Kabanda;
(b)    Chimpempe Mission; and
(c)    Chief Chama’s Palace.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a metro between Kitwe and Livingstone; and
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a high speed intra-city railway system.

questions.minister: Minister of Health whether the Government is considering providing anti-rabies drugs for free to victims of rabid dogs.
Minister of Finance and National Planning
parts: (a)    how many members the Public Service Pension Fund (PSFP) had as of 31st March, 2012; and
(b)    why retirees still travel to the Headquarters of the PSFP for their benefits when the institution is decentralised to provinces.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    what the total revenue, in Zambian Kwacha, realised from the sale of copper by the following mining companies from January to December, 2011 was:
(i)    Konkola Copper Mines; (ii)    Kansanshi Mining Plc; (iii)    Chibuluma Mines Plc; (iv)    Mopani Copper Mines; and
(v)    Lumwana Mining Company; and
(b)    how many tonnes of copper were produced by each of the mining companies during the period at (a) above.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the construction of the following schools in Kapiri-Mposhi Parliamentary Constituency will be completed
parts: (a)    Kapiri-Mposhi Day High; and
(b)    Kapiri-Mposhi Girls’ Technical.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication whether the Government has any plans to revise the terms of the concession agreement entered into between itself and the Railway Systems of Zambia.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    whether the Government has completed renovating all the Ministerial houses countrywide;
(b)    how much money had been spent, on rehabilitating the Ministerial houses in Lusaka and Copperbelt Provinces as of 30th May, 2012;
(c)    who the contractors for the rehabilitation works at (b) above were; and
(d)    how the contractors were selected.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    how many managers at ZESCO Limited had their contracts terminated between 25th September, 2011 and 30th April, 2012;
(b)    what necessitated the action at (a) above; and
(c)    how much money was paid out in terminal benefits.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the Government will construct a secondary school in Bupe Ward in Kamfinsa Parliamentary Constituency to cater for the growing population; and
(b)    when construction of the following schools will be completed:
(i)    Misaka Community; and (ii)    Chibanse Basic.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education why seven schools in Mambolomoka Ward in Shangombo District are still being administered from Kalabo District.

parts: (a)    how many Permanent Secretaries were in Government service as of 31st March, 2012; and
(b)    under what type of contract of employment the Permanent Secretaries serve.

questions.minister: Minister of Health whether the Government has any plans to construct health posts in the following Chiefdoms in Lundazi
parts: (a)    Chief Kapichila’s area, at Chideza, Nkhazi Mwene, Katopola, Chiswe and Kakumba;
(b)    Senior Chief Mwase’s area at Nthitimila;
(c)    Chief Mpamba’s area, at Fyofyo and Kaithinde; and
(d)    if not, whether consideration will be given in 2013.
